articles.description: Listen to BBC Radio 5 Live commentary and follow live text updates as Arsenal face Juventus and Manchester City travel to face Hammarby in the UEFA Women's Champions League.
articles.title: Women's Champions League LIVE: Arsenal vs Juventus & Hammarby vs Manchester City - scores, radio & text

articles.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola signs a two-year contract extension to keep him at the club until 2027.
articles.title: Pep Guardiola contract: Manchester City manager signs two-year extension

articles.description: Lina Hurtig scores a dramatic late goal to seal victory over Juventus as Arsenal qualify for the Women's Champions League quarter-finals.
articles.title: Arsenal 1-0 Juventus: Late Lina Hurtig goal gives Gunners victory over Juve

articles.description: Max Verstappen tells BBC Sport in Las Vegas about the approach that has brought him to the cusp of a fourth world title.
articles.title: Max Verstappen: Red Bull driver on racing to 'the limit'

articles.description: In-form Khadija Shaw scores twice as Manchester City beat Hammarby to reach the quarter-finals of the Women's Champions League with two games to spare.
articles.title: Hammarby 1-2 Manchester City: Khadija Shaw scores twice as Man City win in Champions League

articles.description: Tottenham head coach Ange Postecoglou says Rodrigo Bentancur is an "outstanding person" that made a "mistake" with his racial slur against team-mate Son Heung-min.
articles.title: Rodrigo Bentancur ban: Ange Postecoglou backs Tottenham against severity of midfielder's ban

articles.description: BBC Sport takes a tactical look at Unai Emery's Aston Villa struggles after four consecutive defeats.
articles.title: Aston Villa tactics: Four challenges for Unai Emery's faltering Premier League side

articles.description: From rejection at Benfica to new Manchester United head coach, BBC Sport charts the rise of Ruben Amorim.
articles.title: The story of Ruben Amorim: Man Utd's new manager branded the 'second Special One'

articles.description: Two-time Olympic champion Alistair Brownlee announces his retirement from the sport at the age of 36.
articles.title: Alistair Brownlee: Double Olympic champion retires aged 36

articles.description: Refereeing body PGMOL says Premier League official David Coote's ongoing "welfare" is "important to us" as its investigation into his conduct continues.
articles.title: David Coote: Premier League referee's 'welfare' is 'important' to PGMOL during investigation
